newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Oil climbs to new high for the year.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Oil climbs to new high for the year.

text.p: Nippon Oil Co Ltd's shares climbed to a new high for the calendar year on Thursday morning as foreign investors sought shares that have been lagging the market in order to balance out their portfolios, brokers said.
At midday, the shares were up 12 yen at 627 in turnover of 2.12 million. Nippon Oil was the seventh most actively traded issue on the first section of the Tokyo bourse.
The refiner's shares renewed their yearly high for the second consecutive day.

"Until now Nippon Oil was considered an underperformer but investors need to even out sector weightings in their portfolios and it is no surprise that the shares are being bought," a broker at a "Big Four" brokerage said. "Some feel that the issue is a laggard."
